definition: to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries

sentences.english: After some time, Seung Hyun came into the group and there was a reshuffling of the group members.
sentences.chinese: 一段時間後，李承鉉走進組，有一個小組成員改組。

sentences.english: Finally, in March this year, there was a large reshuffle between the 3 teams of AKB48.
sentences.chinese: 在今年的三月三個隊伍都進行了重大的改組。

sentences.english: Iraq's prime minister is promising the cabinet shakeup.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克總理許諾進行內閣改組。

sentences.english: He reshuffled the cabinet to firm his government.
sentences.chinese: 他改組內閣以強化其政府。

sentences.english: When they reorganized the company, they made a clean sweep of all the holdovers .
sentences.chinese: 當他們重新改組公司時，撤換了所有的留用人員。

sentences.english: Various forces are being re-grouped and reorganized.
sentences.chinese: 國際上各種力量正在經歷新的分化改組。

sentences.english: China will actively attract foreign investment in reorganizing and transforming SOEs.
sentences.chinese: 中國將積極吸收外資參與國有企業改組改造。

sentences.english: The designing institute has been revamped recently to adapt itself to the new developing circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 設計院最近進行了改組以適應新的形勢發展。

sentences.english: Citi yesterday unveiled a further shake-up of its capital markets operation.
sentences.chinese: 花旗昨日披露了其資本市場業務進一步改組計劃。

sentences.english: In Greece, the prime minister reshuffled his Cabinet and replaced his finance minister.
sentences.chinese: 在希臘，英國首相改組內閣和更換他的財政部長。

sentences.english: But the magazine’s owners have apparently resisted reorganizing the publication or vastly increasing its funding..
sentences.chinese: 但股東顯然反對改組或大幅度加大投資。

sentences.english: Use reconstituted egg mix immediately or refrigerate and use within 1 hour.
sentences.chinese: 利用雞蛋混合立即改組或冷藏1個小時。

sentences.english: Bill retooled Microsoft to respond to the threat.
sentences.chinese: 比爾改組了微軟並進行了還擊。

sentences.english: Paul also reorganized the curia and spoke strongly for peace and social justice.
sentences.chinese: 保羅也改組教廷，並以強烈的和平和社會正義。

sentences.english: He had to find another way. So he decided to reorganize his whole cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 所以，他決定改組他的內閣。

sentences.english: The prime minister reshuffled his Cabinet yesterday.

definition: to ask sb to resign from a post
to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
Mainland Affairs Council (Taiwan), abbr. for 大陸委員會|大陆委员会
to shut down/to terminate/to cancel/to go out of business
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
China watcher/an expert on China/an old China hand
